New Records: The Oklahoma City Thunder earned their 13th consecutive NBA victory — and longest winning streak since the franchise moved to Oklahoma City — in a 116-98 win over the Los Angeles Clippers.
Key Match Events: The Thunder scored 31 total points off turnovers in the win.
Oklahoma City trimmed the deficit to four on Jalen Williams’ running pull-up jumper at the buzzer.
Pre-Game Insights: Los Angeles — missing James Harden (right groin soreness) for this contest — has lost back-to-back games.
Post-Match Reflections: The Thunder, leading the NBA in points off turnovers, cranked up the heat defensively in the third quarter to take control.
Thunder coach Mark Daigneault to sit Gilgeous-Alexander for the entire fourth quarter on the first night of a back-to-back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers got off to a hot start offensively, making seven of their first 10 shots.
The Thunder sank just one of nine shots from beyond the arc in the first quarter.
Others: The Thunder will look to win their 14th straight game on Friday against the New York Knicks.
The Clippers’ leading scorer this season, Norman Powell, missed his first 10 shots and didn’t connect until four minutes into the fourth.
